bug.short_desc: Update the CSS features for IE8

long_desc.thetext:
The IE8 has changed some CSS properties with a prefix to be standard conform.
Have a look at the blog entry: http://blogs.msdn.com/ie/archive/2008/09/08/microsoft-css-vendor-extensions.aspx
The renaming of the CSS properties (in parentheses) has an effect on the classes: qx.bom.Vml (behavior) qx.bom.element.Decoration (filter) qx.bom.element.Opacity (filter, zoom) qx.bom.element.Overflow (overflow-x, overflow-y) qx.bom.element.Style (text-overflow) qx.ui.progressive.renderer.table.Row (text-overflow) qx.ui.progressive.renderer.table.cell.Icon (filter)
Chris, why not trying to straighten this out towards a 1.0?

"... the non-prefixed versions of properties that existed in Internet Explorer 7, though considered deprecated, will continue to function in Internet Explorer 8." (http://blogs.msdn.com/ie/archive/2008/09/08/microsoft-css-vendor-extensions.aspx)
Due to the fact that the non-prefixed versions runs in IE8 without any problems, I set it to WONTFIX.
As this is a feature which is deprecated WONTFIX seems to be a little "strong". I would highly prefer to keep it open as an enhancement.

I'm not sure if this is really deprecated, because this quotation from comment #5 was from the blog post. But in the msdn library I found noting about deprecation. The only thing I found for e.q. "behavior" was this: "Internet Explorer 8. The -ms-behavior attribute is an extension to CSS, and can be be used as a synonym for behavior in IE8 mode." [1]
I think it is okay to leave the bug as WONTFIX, because it seems to me that this is not really deprecated, only a synonym. Perhaps is will be deprecated for IE9, but this bug is for IE8. And I would prefer to open a new bug report for that.
[1] http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms530723%28VS.85%29.aspx
